attr.q: Prove the assertion of the last paragraph. Hint: If you're not already familiar with the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, you may find it helpful to familiarize yourself with it.
attr.a:
By Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, abla C \cdot \Delta v's least possible value is - \lVert abla C Vert \lVert \Delta v Vert and it only happens when \Delta v is colinear to abla C therefore

ext{min}( abla C \cdot \Delta v) \ = - \lVert abla C Vert \lVert \eta abla C Vert

\lVert \eta abla C Vert should be \epsilon therefore

\eta = {\epsilon \over \lVert abla C Vert}
